title: How to Catch a Smeargle in Pokemon Go

steps.headline: Open Pokémon Go.
steps.description: This app icon looks like a red and white PokéBall that you can find on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching.

steps.headline: Tap the PokéBall.
steps.description: You'll see this centered on your screen.

steps.headline: Tap Items.
steps.description: You'll see this circular backpack icon towards the right bottom corner of your screen.

steps.headline: Tap Camera.
steps.description: This is the large picture of a camera and will pull up a listing of your available Pokémon.

steps.headline: Tap a Pokémon.
steps.description: You'll need to choose which Pokémon to take snapshots of. Smeargle is most likely going to photobomb one of these pictures. It doesn't matter which Pokémon you pick to snapshot.

steps.headline: Look around your surroundings for a flat surface.
steps.description: You won't get the prompt to place your Pokémon if there isn't a flat surface (like the ground) in the image.

steps.headline: Tap anywhere on your screen to place your Pokémon (when prompted).
steps.description: You'll see yellow footprints on the screen where you can place your Pokémon and the directions on your screen will update. You'll throw a PokéBall at the space and your Pokémon will stand there.

steps.headline: Press the green camera icon in the bottom center of your screen.
steps.description: This will capture the image on your screen. You should probably take multiple pictures to increase your chances of finding a Smeargle.

steps.headline: Tap the icon to exit the camera.
steps.description: You'll see the rectangle icon with the arrow pointing out of it in the top left corner of your screen. You'll see a summary of the photos you took.

steps.headline: Swipe through your captured images to find Smeargle.
steps.description: If you don't see Smeargle photo bombing any of your pictures, you can try again by repeating the process of picking the camera from your items, picking a Pokémon, and taking pictures with your Pokémon. If you found Smeargle, continue to the next steps.

steps.headline: Tap the X.
steps.description: You'll see this centered at the bottom of your screen. You will return to the map view of your avatar. Smeargle should appear near you.

steps.headline: Tap Smeargle.
steps.description: The normal process for catching a Pokémon in Pokémon Go will start. Throw PokéBalls at Smeargle to catch him. Higher-level PokéBalls increase your chance to successfully capture Smeargle.

text: Open Pokémon Go. This app icon looks like a red and white PokéBall that you can find on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. Tap the PokéBall. You'll see this centered on your screen. Tap Items. You'll see this circular backpack icon towards the right bottom corner of your screen. Tap Camera. This is the large picture of a camera and will pull up a listing of your available Pokémon. Tap a Pokémon. You'll need to choose which Pokémon to take snapshots of. Smeargle is most likely going to photobomb one of these pictures. It doesn't matter which Pokémon you pick to snapshot. Look around your surroundings for a flat surface. You won't get the prompt to place your Pokémon if there isn't a flat surface (like the ground) in the image. Tap anywhere on your screen to place your Pokémon (when prompted). You'll see yellow footprints on the screen where you can place your Pokémon and the directions on your screen will update. You'll throw a PokéBall at the space and your Pokémon will stand there. Press the green camera icon in the bottom center of your screen. This will capture the image on your screen. You should probably take multiple pictures to increase your chances of finding a Smeargle. Tap the icon to exit the camera. You'll see the rectangle icon with the arrow pointing out of it in the top left corner of your screen. You'll see a summary of the photos you took. Swipe through your captured images to find Smeargle. If you don't see Smeargle photo bombing any of your pictures, you can try again by repeating the process of picking the camera from your items, picking a Pokémon, and taking pictures with your Pokémon. If you found Smeargle, continue to the next steps. Tap the X. You'll see this centered at the bottom of your screen. You will return to the map view of your avatar. Smeargle should appear near you. Tap Smeargle. The normal process for catching a Pokémon in Pokémon Go will start. Throw PokéBalls at Smeargle to catch him. Higher-level PokéBalls increase your chance to successfully capture Smeargle.
